metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14647 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Python's elementtree C accelerator failed to initialise Expat's hash saltduring initialization. This could make it easy to conduct denial of serviceattacks against Expat by constructing an XML document that would causepathological hash collisions in Expat's internal data structures, consuminglarge amounts CPU and RAM. The vulnerability exists in Python versions3.7.0, 3.6.0 through 3.6.6, 3.5.0 through 3.5.6, 3.4.0 through 3.4.9, 2.7.0through 2.7.15.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14647` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
libpython2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
python2.7-examples - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python3.5 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5').
python2.7 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4').
